1.content: The Python Environments category lists the Python environments that VS Code detects from the compute system it's operating in (your desktop, Codespaces, remote server, etc.). It shows all Python environments grouped by type (for example, conda, venv)â€”whether the IPyKernel is installed or not.Note: You do not need to install jupyter into the Python environment you want to use. Only the IPyKernel package is required to launch a Python process as a kernel and execute code against your notebook (pip install ipykernel). Visit the Jupyter extension wiki to learn more.
1.title: Python Environments

2.content: In React, the useState hook allows you to add state to functional components. It's an essential feature for building dynamic UIs where the component needs to react to user interactions or other events. You can initialize state by passing the initial value as an argument to useState.
2.title: React useState Hook

3.content: REST (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style for building distributed systems. It relies on stateless communication protocols, typically HTTP. RESTful services define a set of constraints like statelessness, uniform interface, and resource representation using URIs.
3.title: Introduction to REST APIs

4.content: A neural network consists of layers of interconnected nodes. Each node in a layer processes an input, applies a weight and an activation function, and passes the result to the next layer. The final output layer generates predictions based on the input data.
4.title: Basics of Neural Networks

5.content: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides low-level utility classes to build custom designs without leaving your HTML. Instead of predesigned components, Tailwind offers a set of utility classes that can be combined to create any design.
5.title: Tailwind CSS Overview

6.content: The Event Loop in JavaScript is responsible for executing tasks, handling asynchronous operations like network requests, and managing events. It continuously checks the call stack and callback queue, processing the events once the call stack is empty.
6.title: JavaScript Event Loop
